intro: Cyclobalanopsis daimingshanensis, commonly known as Daimingshan ironwood, is a rare and endemic species native to the Daimingshan region in China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, dense wood. The plant is a deciduous tree that can reach heights of up to 30 meters, with broad, lance-shaped leaves that turn yellow in autumn. Its fruit is a坚果 (nut) enclosed in a spiny cupule, typical of the genus Cyclobalanopsis. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation priority.
